tweet: This has now passed the House! Looking forward to the President signing my provision into law soon. https://twitter.com/SenGaryPeters/status/1063163442641715201 …

I’ve been very disturbed by Saudi Arabia’s actions: from the humanitarian catastrophe in Yemen to the murder of Jamal Khashoggi.  I’ve previously voted to end support for Saudi-led coalition in Yemen—and am cosponsoring @SenSanders’ effort for today's vote https://wapo.st/2FKUmA6

Even President Trump’s agencies agree: if we don't take climate change seriously, it will devastate our economy, environment & our way of life. Climate change can be an opportunity for new, clean-energy jobs in MI & across the U.S. We must act now. https://nyti.ms/2P7nh0I

Congress and the Trump Administration must focus on policies that encourage automakers to invest in American R&D and manufacturing facilities to create good-paying jobs in the United States and ensure continued American leadership in the automotive industry. (3/3)

As GM considers further investment and employment decisions, I strongly encourage them to hire, invest and grow here in the United States. American workers make the best products, and they can out-compete anyone when given a level playing field. (2/3)

I’m extremely disappointed by GM’s announcement to cut thousands of jobs, and my heart goes out to the Michigan workers and their families who are receiving this terrible news during the holiday season. (1/3)

Congratulations to yesterday’s @MotorCityMatch awardees! These entrepreneurs have worked tirelessly to bring their creative visions to life. I’m proud of their hard work to help grow Detroit’s economy and bring new opportunities to every corner of the city. pic.twitter.com/VpLVfJWROB

I held a subcommittee field summit on #PFAS exposure Tuesday in Grand Rapids to help inform actions the federal government must take to address this crisis. See some of the highlights via @FOX17: http://bit.ly/2K6lub4

That’s why I’m glad the Senate passed my provision to establish a Center of Expertise for Great Lakes oil spill response. This is an important step in ensuring we are better prepared to protect our resources for future generations. http://bit.ly/2FnNSGV

Last year the Coast Guard Commandant told me they were not prepared for an oil spill in the #GreatLakes & that more research must be done. That’s incredibly alarming—40 million people rely on the Great Lakes for safe drinking water.

#PFAS contamination is a national health crisis—and the EPA must prioritize it accordingly. I’ll continue pressing the Trump Administration for swift action. From @WNEMTV5news → pic.twitter.com/kx3swsGrZM
